question: Saturn is the ________ planet from the Sun.
feedback: Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun and the second-largest in the Solar System, after Jupiter.

question: Which image shows a close-up of Saturn?
Saturn is made mostly of Hydrogen.
feedback: Saturn is made up of 96% Hydrogen, 3% Helium, and has small traces of many other substances.

question: One year on Saturn is equivalent to how many years on Earth?
feedback: With an average orbital speed of 9.69km/s, it takes Saturn 29.457 Earth years (or 10,759 Earth days) to complete a single revolution around the Sun.

question: What is the name of Saturn's largest moon?
feedback: Titan, at 5,151km diameter, is Saturn's largest moon. It's the second largest in our Solar System!

question: Saturn is visible from Earth without a telescope.
feedback: Saturn is visible with the naked eye for most of the year, except for short periods of time when it's too close to the Sun to observe

question: Only one spacecraft has visited Saturn.
feedback: A total of four spacecrafts have visited Saturn - Pioneer 11, Voyager 1 & 2, and Cassini-Huygens.
